skill.description: Use when the user asks for a roadmap, timeline, phased plan, or execution sequence.

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only YAML frontmatter and markdown documentation describing when and how to use the planning action. No executable code, no file I/O, no network calls, no command execution. Pure metadata and documentation file.

content.user_title: Create Execution Roadmaps and Phased Plans
content.value_statement: Users struggle to break down complex goals into actionable steps with clear timelines. This skill transforms any objective into a structured phased plan with milestones, dependencies, and risk contingencies.
actual_capabilities: Define project scope and explicit non-scope boundaries
Break complex goals into logical phases with milestones
Identify dependencies between tasks and phases
Analyze risks and define contingency approaches
Structure validation checkpoints for progress verification
limitations: Does not execute or track progress after plan creation
Does not integrate with project management tools
Does not provide estimates for effort or duration
Does not assign resources or responsibilities

use_cases.title: Product Launch Roadmap
use_cases.description: Transform feature ideas into phased rollout plans with milestones and dependency mapping for cross-functional teams.

use_cases.title: Technical Migration Plan
use_cases.description: Break down system migrations into safe phases with rollback contingencies and validation checkpoints.

use_cases.title: Go-to-Market Strategy
use_cases.description: Convert business objectives into execution timelines with clear scope boundaries and risk mitigation steps.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Roadmap
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a phased roadmap for achieving [GOAL] with [CONSTRAINTS]. Include scope, non-scope, phases, dependencies, and risks.

prompt_templates.title: Detailed Timeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a detailed execution timeline for [PROJECT] with milestones, validation checkpoints, and contingency plans for [RISKS].

prompt_templates.title: Risk-Focused Plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Plan [INITIATIVE] with emphasis on risk identification. For each phase, specify what could go wrong and how to respond.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Stakeholder Plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an execution plan for [GOAL] that addresses constraints from [STAKEHOLDER_1] and [STAKEHOLDER_2] with clear scope boundaries.

output_examples.input: Create a plan for migrating our monolithic app to microservices over the next 6 months.
output: Goal: Migrate monolithic application to microservices architecture within 6 months
Constraints: Zero customer-facing downtime, maintain current feature velocity
Scope: Core services identified in architecture review, authentication layer, data layer
Non-Scope: Legacy reporting features, admin dashboard rewrite, mobile API v2
Phase 1 (Months 1-2): Foundation - Set up CI/CD pipeline, container orchestration, monitoring stack
Phase 2 (Months 2-3): Auth Service - Extract authentication, validate with canary deployment
Phase 3 (Months 3-4): User Service - Extract user management, run parallel with monolith
Phase 4 (Months 4-5): Core Business Logic - Migrate primary domain services
Phase 5 (Months 5-6): Data Layer - Migrate database schema, enable service-to-service communication
Dependencies: Kubernetes cluster ready before Phase 1, monitoring in place before each service migration
Risks: Performance degradation during transition, data consistency issues during cutover, team learning curve
Contingencies: Rollback to monolith for affected services, feature flags for gradual traffic shifting

best_practices: Always restate the goal and constraints at the start to ensure alignment before planning
Define explicit non-scope to prevent scope creep and manage stakeholder expectations
Include validation checkpoints after each phase to verify progress before continuing
anti_patterns: Creating a plan without first confirming the actual goal and constraints with the user
Skipping scope definition, leading to unclear boundaries and endless feature additions
Failing to identify dependencies, causing blockers that could have been avoided

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, OpenAI Codex, and Claude Code. It is compatible with any LLM that supports structured reasoning.

faq.question: How detailed should plans be?
faq.answer: Keep plans at milestone level initially. Deeper detail can be added iteratively for specific phases as work begins.

faq.question: Can I integrate with Jira or Asana?
faq.answer: This skill generates plans as text output. You can copy the plan to your project management tool manually.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This skill only processes text input. No data is stored, sent externally, or used for training purposes.

faq.question: What if plans become outdated?
faq.answer: Regenerate plans as needed. The skill can adapt existing plans when constraints or goals change.

faq.question: How is this different from procedural actions?
faq.answer: Planning actions create new roadmaps. Procedural actions execute repeatable SOPs. Use planning for unique initiatives.
